chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell D. Hagamon III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:03 pm - Defendant Darrell D. Hagamon in court with attorney Courtney C. Jolin.  Defendant Darrell D. Hagamon in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar/Jolin/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence
Jail 5 months - Jail credit 86 days - W/Huber for all purposes - May serve in Vilas County
Appeal rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

02:17 pm - Defendant Darrell D. Hagamon in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Voorhees files Exhibit 1 (Letter from employer)-Rec'd.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 9 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Participate in Educational Program/Job Skill Program and/or employment
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

09:44 am - Defendant Darrell D. Hagamon in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sommer statement to Affirmative Defense if conceded by defense - willing to amend to a Class A Misdemeanor - Abandoning Vehicle within 24 hours from taking.  Voorhees statement concerning Affirmative Defense and amending of complaint.  Court will accept the State's motion to amend to 943.23(2) a Class A Misdemanor.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
